Package com.jpmorrsn.fbp.components

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Collate
    Component to collate two or more streams of packets, based on a list of control field lengths held in the CTLFIELDS IIP Control fields in incoming IPs are assumed to be contiguous, starting at byte 0 Input streams are assumed to be sorted on the same control fields, in ascending order
    Concatenate
    Component to concatenate two or more streams of packets
    ConcatStr
    Component to concatenate all packets in the input stream into one long String, which is then sent to the output port.
    Copy
    Component to copy all incoming packets - mostly used for debugging purposes.
    Counter
    Component to count a stream of packets, and output the result on the COUNT port.
    Crash  
    Discard
    Component to discard all incoming packets - mostly used for debugging purposes.
    DispIPCounts
    Generate a stream of IP counts under control of a timer
    EnhancedWriteFile
    Component to write data to a file, using a stream of packets.
    FBPComponentTemplate
    Description
    Gate  
    GenSamples
    Component to generate arrays of sound samples from note frequencies and times.
    Heartbeat
    Component to generate packets every 'n' milliseconds, where 'n' is specified in an InitializationConnection.
    Inject
    Component to inject an IIP String as an IP
    Kick
    Component to generate a single packet - mostly used for debugging.
    KickWD
    Component to kick-start processing, emitting an IP with specified data
    ListFiles
    Component to step through a directory, generating two streams of packets: - directories go to port DIRS - files go to port FILES The file name is specified as a String via an InitializationConnection.
    LoadBalance
    Component to assign incoming packets to the output port that has the smallest backlog of packets waiting to be processed.
    Output  
    Passthru
    Pass a stream of packets to an output stream.
    Prefix
    Prefix each packet IN with the given String PRE and copy it to OUT.
    RandomDelay
    Component to pass packets through with random delay.
    ReadEmails
    Component to read data from an Inbox file, generating a stream of emails.
    ReadFile
    Component to read data from a file, generating a stream of packets.
    ReadFromSocket
    Server side Component to read data from socket, generating a stream of packets.
    RegExReplace
    Component to find occurrences of a pattern and replace them with the second pattern.
    ReplString
    Replicate a stream of Packets to 'n' output streams, where each Packet points at a String.
    RRMerge  
    SelNthItem
    Component to select a specific item from a stream, by number Bob Corrick, November 2011: Make REJ port optional, and update the description.
    ShowText
    Component to write data to a Swing pane.
    ShowURL
    Component to drive a browser.
    Sort
    Sort a stream of Packets to an output stream
    SoundMixer
    Component to play sequence of 1-second sound buffers This component is the "front-end" of PlayTune
    Splitter1
    Component to split an input stream into multiple output streams, where the first 30 packets go to the first output port, the next 30 go to the second and so on.
    StartsWith
    Select packets starting with specified string.
    SubstreamSensitiveMerge  
    TestStack
    Component to do simple stack testing.
    Text2IntArray
    Convert comma-separated text to an array of ints
    WriteFile
    Component to write data to a file, using a stream of packets.
    WriteToConsole
    Component to write data to the console, using a stream of packets.
    WriteToSocket
    Client side Component to write data to a socket, using a stream of packets.
